channel.title: Removing IP
channel.description: Hi, im having a small problem. I removed the up test bar from client.java so when you login all you see is Username and Password. However even though thats all you see, if users are at Password and they click Enter they still go to the ip section even though they cant see it. Because of that, they can also modify it so it connects to another server. If anyone knows how i can fix this, that would be great. thnks

item.title: Removing IP
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[center][/center]

[center][size=19pt]====Hamachi Servers====[/size]
Hamachi Servers are LESS DESIRABLE to use over uTorrent or NO-IP.

Pros
-Chat System
-IP Checker
-Simple to Download

Cons
-Some Servers may Contain Viruses
-Never 24\7
-More Lag

====Downloading Hamachi==== -Please Use the Download link Listed below.
----> https://secure.logmein.com/products/hamachi/list.asp <----

====Downloading Win.rar====[/size]-Please Use the Download link Listed below.
----> www.download.com/WinRAR/3000-2250_4-10007677.html <----[/center]

[size=15pt]====Creating a Hamachi Server====[/size]
-Download Hamachi
-Download Win.rar
-Download a Base Server (you should browse MoparScape Server Downloads for one)
-Click on the small triangle in the bottom right corner of Hamachi and press “Create NetWork”
-The Default Password is 123, use this as your password unless you would like your server to be private.
-Open up a client that has an IP changer. (Get one here ----> http://w13.easy-share.com/1700400917.html <----)
-Change the IP to the number at the top of the Hamachi Client. (Include the Dots)
-Advertise your Server on the MoparScape Hamachi Server Status List. You can do so here ----> http://www.moparisthebest.com/hamachi.php <----

________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

[right]PLEASE NOTE

-If you decide to join a hamachi server make sure you have a good firewall enabled and do not
accept any files from anyone you do not trust with access to your computer.[/right]

________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________
[size=15pt]====Hosting a Server without PortFowarding====[/size]
Purpose: Don’t know the Router password?/Portforward? Or is Hamchi just too much of a pain? Just download uTorrent? Easy.
Difficulty: 3/10.
Procedure/Chapters: 5

====Table Of Contents====
Introduction - How does it work?
Step 1 - Obtain your Port Number
Step 2 - Installing uTorrent
Step 3 - Navigation
Step 4 - Selecting your port
Step 5 - Additional Procedure
Step 6 - Getting a NO-IP
Step 7 - Logging onto your server

Introduction:
Today I am going to teach you how to host games (including RS2 servers) without using Hamachi or having to access your router. Using this method you can automaticly forward up to 1 port temporarily without needing to know your router info, all by using a familiar and unexpected program: uTorrent.

How does it work:
uTorrent works by automaticly forwarding a selected port to ensure your computer will accept incoming and outgoing connections require to download .torrent filetypes. The new versions of uTorrent conveniently allow you to modify that port. This got me thinking, would I be able to use this to somehow temporarily port forward?

Step 1:
Figure out which port your server is listening on. This is pretty easy to discover, it’s usually displayed right in your runserver.bat upon start-up. As you know, many of the servers created today include the ability to modify your port, but 43594 is the default java compound gaming cache port.

Step 2:
Download and install uTorrent. This comes directly from the uTorrent website, I have also run a virus scan to make sure the link will contain no malware.

utorrent.com

µTorrent - a (very) tiny BitTorrent client

Download the official µTorrent® (uTorrent) torrent client for Windows, Mac, Android or Linux-- uTorrent is the #1 bittorrent download client on desktops worldwide.

utorrentdload.jpg790×252

Step 3:
Once uTorrent is installed correctly, boot it up. Browse through the first-run setup, put in the obvious things. When you have completed this task, navigate to the top of the screen and select Options -> Preferences -> Connection.

Step 4:
You should see a screen with the title Connection and a box for “Port used for incoming connections”. Simply modify this to 43594, or whichever port you happen to be using. Make sure “Randomize Port every time uTorrent starts” is UNCHECKED and that “Add uTorrent to firewall exceptions” is CHECKED UPnP and NAT-PMP are a good idea to have CHECKED. Afterwards Click apply.

Step 5:
Once your settings are in, close uTorrent and open/run your gameserver. AFTER your server is up, re-open uTorrent and make sure that the settings you put in were saved properly. MINIMIZE uTorrent and you should be hosting.

minimize.jpg1024×22

Step 6:
First go to the NO-IP official website. (----> http://www.no-ip.com/ <----)
Now Register With NO-IP. Use your real eMail adress because you will need to Confirm your account.
Select “Your-NO-IP” and then Add a Host.
Hostname:Your Choice
Hosttype: DNS Host (A)
IP Adress:Auto-Set
Assign to Group:No Group
Enable Wildcard:DO NOT TOUCH
MX Record Name:Leave Blank
The “Number 5” on the Corner:DO NOT TOUCH
Select on “Create Host”

no-ipaddahost.jpg906×697

createhost.jpg709×596

managehosts.jpg912×682

Step 7:
Open up a Client (Silab Preffered)
Change the IP to your NO-IP
Choose a Username and Password
Hit Log In

–You Should Now Be Logged In Onto Your Server–

Step 8:
To Become an Owner Go to the “Characters” Folder
Double Click Your Name
Look for…

[CHARACTER] character-height = 0 character-posx = 2208 character-posy = 4956 character-rights = 0 <---- Change this to, 1 = Mod, 2 = Admin, 3 = Co-Owner/Owner character-ismember = 0 character-messages = 0 character-lastconnection = Thomas-PC character-lastlogin = 20081026 character-energy = 100 character-gametime = 0 character-gamecount = 6758

Now Hit The X in the Corner and then Choose Save
Relogg onto your server and you should become an Owner
To know what commands you can do type ::commands for more help with your base server type ::help, also most servers have a starter-package, type ::starter if you would like to get it.

Common Commands

::home
::jad
::starter
::master
::pure
::skiller
::pk
::pkbox
::slayer
::kqueen::kq
::givemod
::giveadmin
::giveowner
::xteleto
::xteletome
::xteleall
::eat
::afk
::cart
::back[/code]

====Creating Shops====
-Please Download from the link listed below.
http://rapidshare.com/files/49365555/ShopMakerv1-Jaywalker.rar.html

====Creating Commands====
-Please Download from the link listed below.
FILE NOT FOUND: Please search from Google for a Command Generator (----> http://www.google.com// <----)

====Creating Items====
-Please Download from the link listed below.
FILE NOT FOUND: Most Servers Contain an Item Creator. Search for one in the files or do “Base Server” > “Tools” > Item Creator -Follow Instructions on Creator-

====Compiling====
Compilers are usually listed in the Main Files of your Server. Usually called compile.bat or compiler, you need JDK 5.0 or Higher which can be downloaded here (----> java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index_jdk5.jsp <----)

[center]Credits
58% Me for Guide (Took about 8 Hours)
10% MoparScape Forums
10% uTorrent
8% Hamachi
2% NO-IP
12% Others Who Inspired Me[/center]

Please comment, I’ll be glad to help with whatever problems you may have.

NOTICE
-None of the Material on here is “LEECHED!”
-100% of the Guide Text, Pictures, and Links We’re Provided by Invalid
-The Links I have givin are NOT owned by me!
-Please DO NOT FLAME, It is VERY Disrespectful, I have worked over 8 Hours Creating this Guide for the Use of Others;
} Many People Find It “Funny” to Flame Posts when in fact it is not “Funny” at all;
} The Work here Is Intended for the Purpose of Information to the Reader and is not Leeched nor for Advertisement of a Product/Server
-Anyone Advertising or Leeching here shall not get HELP from.
-Also I will lock them from replying on this Post.

[size=12pt][}==—Follow These Guidelines and You Will be Fine—=={][/size]

[size=12pt]----Invalid----[/size]

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @legend-scape legend-scape
item.description:
@legend-scape wrote:

ur all wrong,… go into the client.java and CRTL + F search for the IP thats on the client now, and then change it to urs and it will work ;D

item.title: Removing IP
item.dc:creator: @Iamjesus Iamjesus
item.description:
@Iamjesus wrote:

[quote=“rash, post:6, topic:247135”]open ur EGUI.JAVA

You will see -

[code]import java.awt.BorderLayout;
import java.awt.Cursor;
import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
import javax.swing.*;

public class EGUI
{
public static void main(String args[])
{
client.main(new String[] {
“i.p”, “i.p”, “i.p”
});
}
}
[/code]

put ur i.p were it says i.p, it will connect to urs[/quote]

I think that works too.

Read full topic
